name: Oshi Sofi
description: Oshi Sofi is a festive rice dish cooked with meat, vegetables, and spices. It's often prepared for weddings and special occasions, featuring colorful layers of rice and savory ingredients.

name: Norin
description: Norin is a cold noodle dish made with thin slices of boiled beef or horse meat, mixed with onions and spices. It's commonly enjoyed as a refreshing summer meal.

name: Tandyr Kabob
description: Tandyr Kabob is a type of kebab cooked in a clay oven called a tandyr. It features marinated chunks of meat, typically lamb or beef, skewered and cooked over hot coals.

name: Kazan Kabob
description: Kazan Kabob is a dish where marinated meat, usually lamb, is cooked in a large cast-iron cauldron called a kazan. It's slow-cooked over low heat, resulting in tender and flavorful meat.

name: Fried Eggplant with Garlic Sauce
description: Fried Eggplant with Garlic Sauce is a popular Uzbek appetizer made by frying eggplant slices until golden brown and serving them with a savory garlic sauce.

name: Uzbek Salad
description: Uzbek Salad is a refreshing salad made with tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and fresh herbs like cilantro and parsley. It's often dressed with vinegar, oil, and spices.

name: Kovurma Lagman
description: Kovurma Lagman is a variation of the traditional Lagman dish where the noodles are stir-fried with meat, vegetables, and spices until flavorful and slightly crispy.

name: Tukhum Barak
description: Tukhum Barak is a sweet pastry filled with ground nuts, sugar, and spices. It's often served during festivals and celebrations as a special treat.

name: Shirmoi
description: Shirmoi is a type of noodle soup made with thin noodles, meat, vegetables, and aromatic spices. It's a comforting and nourishing dish enjoyed throughout Uzbekistan.

name: Kutabi
description: Kutabi is a type of stuffed pancake filled with minced meat, herbs, and spices. It's cooked on a griddle until golden brown and served hot with yogurt or sour cream.

name: Palov
description: Palov is a dish made with rice, meat, carrots, and onions, cooked together with spices. It's a staple of Uzbek cuisine and often served at weddings and celebrations.

name: Tashkent Somsa
description: Tashkent Somsa is a type of savory pastry filled with minced meat, onions, and spices. It's baked until golden brown and served as a popular snack or appetizer.

name: Shashlik
description: Shashlik is a skewered and grilled meat dish, often seasoned with spices and served with bread or rice. It's a favorite at outdoor gatherings and picnics.

name: Oshi Nahor
description: Oshi Nahor is a traditional breakfast dish featuring rice served with a variety of toppings, such as meat, vegetables, and yogurt. It's a hearty and flavorful way to start the day.

name: Uzbek Pilaf
description: Uzbek Pilaf is a variation of pilaf made with rice, meat, carrots, and spices. It's cooked in a large pot and often served as the main course for family gatherings and holidays.

name: Chuchvara
description: Chuchvara are small dumplings filled with spiced meat and onions, similar to Russian pelmeni or Turkish manti. They're boiled and typically served with sour cream or yogurt.

name: Baklava
description: Baklava is a sweet pastry made with layers of filo dough, nuts, and honey or syrup. It's a popular dessert in Uzbekistan and other countries in the region.

name: Somsa
description: Somsa is a type of Uzbek pastry filled with minced meat and onions, often flavored with spices like cumin and coriander. It's typically baked until golden brown and served hot.

name: Halva
description: Halva is a sweet treat made from ground sunflower seeds or sesame seeds mixed with sugar or honey. It's often served as a dessert or snack.

name: Pumpkin Samsa
description: Pumpkin Samsa is a seasonal variation of the traditional Uzbek pastry, filled with spiced pumpkin and onions. It's a delicious and comforting treat during the autumn months.

name: Lagman
description: Lagman is a noodle dish with stir-fried vegetables and meat, flavored with various spices and sauces. It's hearty and flavorful, often served as a main course.

name: Suzma
description: Suzma is a creamy dairy product similar to cottage cheese, often served as a side dish or used in cooking. It's made by straining yogurt to remove the whey.

name: Pamidor Somsa
description: Pamidor Somsa is a type of Uzbek pastry filled with a mixture of tomatoes, onions, and herbs. It's a refreshing and savory snack, especially during the summer months.

name: Somsa with Potato
description: Somsa with Potato is a vegetarian variation of the traditional Uzbek pastry, filled with seasoned mashed potatoes and onions. It's a comforting and filling snack.

name: Plov with Chickpeas
description: Plov with Chickpeas is a flavorful rice dish cooked with meat, carrots, onions, and chickpeas, seasoned with spices like cumin and coriander. It's a hearty and satisfying meal.

name: Gazpacho
description: Gazpacho is a cold soup made with ripe tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, onions, and garlic, seasoned with olive oil and vinegar. It's refreshing and perfect for hot summer days.

name: Shalgam
description: Shalgam is a fermented turnip juice, often served as a refreshing beverage or used as a base for soups and stews. It has a tangy and slightly spicy flavor.

name: Kefir
description: Kefir is a fermented dairy drink made with kefir grains, which are a combination of bacteria and yeast. It's tangy and slightly effervescent, often enjoyed for its probiotic benefits.

name: Uzbek Kebab
description: Uzbek Kebab is a variety of skewered and grilled meat dishes, often seasoned with spices and served with flatbread and sauces. It's a popular street food and barbecue option.

name: Baklava with Pistachios
description: Baklava with Pistachios is a variation of the traditional sweet pastry, filled with layers of filo dough, pistachios, and honey or syrup. It's a decadent and indulgent dessert.

name: Mushroom Lagman
description: Mushroom Lagman is a vegetarian version of the traditional Lagman dish, featuring stir-fried mushrooms, vegetables, and noodles seasoned with aromatic spices.

name: Uzbek Dumplings
description: Uzbek Dumplings are small pockets of dough filled with meat, onions, and spices, similar to Russian pelmeni or Turkish manti. They are boiled and served with a side of sour cream or yogurt.

name: Mastava
description: Mastava is a traditional Uzbek rice soup made with meat, rice, carrots, onions, and spices. It's a comforting and nourishing dish often enjoyed during cold weather.

name: Uzbek Noodle Salad
description: Uzbek Noodle Salad is a refreshing salad made with noodles, vegetables, and herbs, dressed with a tangy vinaigrette. It's a light and flavorful dish perfect for summer.

name: Pumpkin Pilaf
description: Pumpkin Pilaf is a variation of the traditional Uzbek pilaf, where chunks of pumpkin are added to the rice along with meat, carrots, and onions. It adds a sweet and savory flavor to the dish.

name: Baklava with Walnuts
description: Baklava with Walnuts is another variation of the classic sweet pastry, filled with layers of filo dough and crushed walnuts, then soaked in honey or syrup. It's a rich and decadent dessert.

name: Uzbek Flatbread
description: Uzbek Flatbread, also known as non, is a staple in Uzbek cuisine. It's a round, flat bread baked in a tandoor oven and often served with meals or used to scoop up sauces and stews.

name: Chalop
description: Chalop is a traditional Uzbek dish made with rice, vegetables, and herbs, often served with a side of yogurt or sour cream. It's a simple yet flavorful dish.

name: Fried Liver
description: Fried Liver is a popular Uzbek appetizer or main dish, where thin slices of liver are seasoned and pan-fried until golden brown and tender. It's often served with onions and herbs.

name: Uzbek Carrot Salad
description: Uzbek Carrot Salad is a vibrant salad made with grated carrots, raisins, nuts, and spices, dressed with a tangy vinaigrette. It's a refreshing and colorful addition to any meal.
